name: JW Marriott Hotel Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all fairness, I travel a fair amount on business, and I chose to stay at the JW Marriott in order to redeem points for free nights. The "free room" on the first nights were on the 10th floor and was an average Marriott room. The hotel is built so that each room is a "corner", which improves the view, including into your neighbors' rooms. It was quite humid when we arrived, and the room smelled very moldy. We were only there for a couple of days, so we didn't complain. We stored our luggage for a few days as we traveled and returned to an "upgraded" room on the 34th floor, which was an identical room but with a view of the harbor (and no smell!). We had hoped to enjoy the executive lounge in the evenings, but it was noisy, crowded, and so brightly lit that you could not even see what would have been a spectacular view of the harbor if the lights had been dimmed. The food and the drinks in the lounge were good, the service good, and the location, over the Pacific Place, outstanding. It is very easy to take the Airport Express from the airport to the MTR station if you don't have a lot of luggage, although we opted to take the hotel limo service which was excellent (750 HKD.) All in all, it felt like a typical business hotel to me, but a good one, at twice the price that you would pay in the States. If you want a more unique Asian luxury hotel experience, I would consider the beautiful Shangri-La, which is located next door to the JW. (We stayed at the SL in Manila and were overwhelmed by their service.) In terms of Hong Kong in general... it's a very clean tourist friendly city.. and is especially a good place to stay over on your way to other destinations in Asia.
reviews.title: Stay at the Shangri-La

likes.disliked: — Lack of privacy due to the

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment the bell boys opened the front door and we stepped inside we were treated like royalty. All the staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful, courteous and extremely efficient. The hotel interior was beautifully decorated and well maintained ; the lobby area being very spacious and grand.
reviews.title: Sheer opulence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 32nd Floor and we had been allocated a Deluxe Panoramic room . The room had two full ceiling to floor windows which looked out onto the mountain . The views were amazing. The room was spotlessly clean, with modern furnishings and nice bathroom fittings. The bed was comfortable. However, It was the little touches that made all the difference. Flowers in the bathroom, a bowl of fruit which was topped up each day , complimentary Wall Street Journal and upon arrival room service bring Jasmine Tea.
reviews.title: location, location, location.....but maybe thats not enough

reviews.text: The facilities and amenities are excellent. the location is perfect. I cannot find fault with this Hotel. I would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent service

reviews.text: Having stayed in HK many times at a number of the 5 star places I was keen to sample this place. The overall feeling is of a quality product, no question about that, and the location above Pacific Place is the key selling point.
reviews.title: A good hotel with excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At check in we decided to upgrade to an executive floor room, for $800 HKD a night + 13% tax. Executive floor is normally 31-35 floor, but because of "some renovation" they had moved the floor to 20-22. Lounge still on 33-35.
reviews.title: Not 5* at the moment

reviews.text: Fair enough, was our first reaction, until we got to the room and discovered that it was a standard room. Small and awkwardly laid out to facilitate the "every room is a corner room" style. Meant the entry to the room was narrow and not ideal for luggage storage.
reviews.title: Love the room

reviews.text: Bathroom was a decent size and well stocked. Necessary magnifying mirror was in place so this guest was happy.
reviews.title: oh, this was good

likes.disliked: — New skyscraper about to be built in front which will ruin the harbour view

reviews.title: Great hotel in the Admiralty district
reviews.text: Not so happy to be disturbed multiple times during the night due to a child screaming in the next room, that followed next morning with the commencement of "renovation" before 9am. Now we had accepted a lower floor room to avoid this noise but we still got it so a room change was required.
Eventually got a new room at 6pm. This was a harbour view room on the 15th floor. Room the same as before, view nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Probably my favourite hotel in the world...

likes.liked: — Service and location are possibly the best combo in HKG.

reviews.text: A few days after New Year I stayed in the Marriott.
reviews.title: Hong Kong

likes.disliked: — Small rooms as usual in HK

reviews.text: The Hotel was very calm and availability of the staff helped to give an overall very good opinion of the stay. Very smiling and helpful, excellent level of English.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location & High Quality Staff

likes.liked: — The friendly professional service and great location

reviews.text: The Hotel itself is still very new or at least recently renovated.
reviews.title: Excellent service

likes.disliked: — The twin bed room is overall a bit small

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Rooms aren't spacious (it is Hong Kong after all) but beautifully furnished. Facilities are of a high class standard, not a single issue with services or anything else.
It had been a few years since I stayed at the JW Marriott in Hong Kong. The office had moved back into that part of town and returning to the hotel was a real pleasure.
reviews.title: Great business hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a week and had a wonderful experience. As others have mentioned, the location is great. It's above an upscale shopping mall, Pacific Place, and the Admiralty MTR (subway) station. Access to the MTR without even having to go outside was a real advantage. The shops in the MTR such as Pret a Manager, 7-11, and Starbucks were very nice to be near as well. There were also banks with ATMs in the MTR. It was beyond convenient.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The location and the hotel facilites (pool, gym, executive lounge)

reviews.text: The other reviews mention that the rooms are on the small side, but most are in Hong Kong, one of the most densely populated area's on the planet. We had 2 adults and 2 children in one room for a week and it was slightly tight. What saved us was that we were on an "Excutive" floor. That gave us access to a large 2 story lounge on the the 35th & 36th floors overlooking the harbor. Every morning there was a free hot cooked breakfast buffet with chinese and english foods to choose from. In the afternoon they put out wine and very good snacks, and after dinner ,coffee, sweets and after dinner drinks. Sodas and waters were available at all times as were 2 internet ready computers, play station video game with assorted games, board games and a range of newspapers and magazines. I highly recommend getting a room on an excutive floor.
reviews.title: Nice location, nice hotel

likes.liked: — Great location for shoppers, mall is next door!
likes.disliked: — The rooms are quite small but nice

reviews.text: Our room had huge windows with drapes that closed with the press of a button by the bed. The beds were firm but comfortable and the tv was fine. There were 110v outlets so no need to bring a power converter from the US.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The pool was lovely and warmly heated when I was there and the jacuzzi was hot and very clean and nice. The robes and slippers they give you were perfect to wear down to the pool
reviews.title: Great Shopping Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym was very clean and well equiped as well.
reviews.title: Good option

reviews.text: Stayed at JW this past Chinese New Year. This is indeed one of the luxury properties in its market, though not necessarily world renown.
reviews.title: OH MY ....... Luxury for under USD300/night

reviews.text: I was able to obtain this property through PriceLine, and I probably got it 30% off as a result of that. On top of that, they kinda liked me, so they upgraded me to sea view for free.
reviews.title: High Class, Good Location, Fantastic Breakfast Buffet

likes.liked: — Breakfast buffet at the Marriott Cafe

reviews.text: The hotel is really nice, and the people are sweet indeed. Property sits on top of the subway station, and it has cabs in front of the door. Airport bus is only a reservation away at HKD150. (At HKD300, 2 people will probably like the cab ride to the airport better, and for 3 persons it is actually cheaper). The concierge is very helpful, and is only an internet screen away from any address, phone number.
reviews.title: JW is A+

likes.liked: — Customer service, and quality of hotel
likes.disliked: — Fitness room is on the sub floors should be in secluded location on one of the hotel floors

reviews.text: They have one buffet or another going all day long, from 6AM to 10 PM. The dinner buffet at HKD600+ is particularly impressive, given that it has lobsters/sushi included in that. Wine list seemed very reasonable, and agreeable. The much hyped about café Too buffet at the Shangri-La is a particularly poor choice, and pricey at HKD400+. (On the other hand their Petrus restaurant is a nice French choice, but the wine list is a bit over priced).
reviews.title: Rooms are small

description: JW Marriott Hotel Hong Kong offers an ideal location set atop the world-famous Pacific Place. The guestrooms at our luxury hotel in Hong Kong boast breathtaking views, contemporary furnishings, luxurious bedding, 42" flat-panel TV and free internet in all guestrooms as well as meeting facilities. Relax with a dip in the outdoor pool. Stay fit in our Hong Kong hotel's 24-hour health club. Enjoy dining at one of our seven award-winning restaurants. Winner of Meetings & Conventions Magazine's Gold Key Award for 11 consecutive years, we offer the finest event facilities to suit a variety of occasions and functions of varying sizes. Our ballroom, the largest on Hong Kong Island can accommodate up to 1,100 guests for receptions. Discover the many rewarding experiences JW Marriott Hotel Hong Kong can offer to complete a memorable stay, whether for business or leisure.
